page.title: 12Coughton Court
page.content: Coughton Court is an interesting building which attracts lots of tourists. The Throckmorton family has lived there since 1409, but the house now belongs to the National Trust. Coughton Court has around 20,000 visitors a year, so you can see that it is very popular. Most foreign visitors come from the U.S.A. and Australia. There are many attractions. Most people come to see the furniture, the paintings and the tapestries. There are even china dishes on the walls of two rooms. The house has some interesting historical stories. One member of the Throckmorton family had a coat made out of sheep wool in one day. There are 3 priest holes. One is really dark and smelly and it goes a very long way down. Coughton Court also has connections with the Gunpowder Plot.
